home.title: OpenEvents - Shared Event Data Layer API for Destinations, Venues & Builders
home.description: OpenEvents is an open event data platform for Slovenia and beyond. Add events once, sync across websites and apps via REST API, webhooks, and MCP. Free tier for builders, transparent pricing.
home.subtitle: Discover and manage events

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.metaDescription: Frequently asked questions about OpenEvents - the shared event data layer for destinations, venues, promoters, and builders.
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about OpenEvents

items.question: What is OpenEvents?
items.answer: OpenEvents is a shared event data layer for destinations, venues, promoters, and builders. Add events once; keep them in sync across websites, apps, and partners.

items.question: Who is it for?
items.answer: Destinations (DMOs/municipalities), venues and promoters, and developers/partners who want a stable, open and transparent way to use event data.

items.question: How do I add events?
items.answer: Use our intuitive dashboard, reach out to dev team to connect to your existing solution, or connect popular, existing sources (e.g., Facebook Events, Eventbrite, Meetup, ICS feeds).

items.question: Can I embed this on my site?
items.answer: Yes. Use our website widget or fetch data via API to render your own calendar.

items.question: How do you keep data clean?
items.answer: We standardize fields, merge duplicates (matching title + time + venue), and normalize venue names. Low-confidence items go to a human review queue.

items.question: How fast are updates?
items.answer: Near real-time for most sources. Exact timing depends on the source and your plan, but changes typically flow through within minutes.

items.question: Do you show where data came from?
items.answer: Yes. We include clear source links on event cards and in the API.

items.question: Who owns the data?
items.answer: You do. You can export data anytime (ICS/CSV/JSON) or connect your external third-party source. We don't lock you in.

items.question: Can I choose what's public?
items.answer:
Yes. Each event can be marked public, internal or shared with specified partners.

Public: Anyone can see itâ€”on your website, in public calendars, and via the public API/feed. It's searchable, sharable, and shows source links.

Use for: city festivals, museum shows, open workshops.

Partner: Only approved partners (with a key or special embed) can see it. It won't appear in public feeds, but destinations/hotels/media you trust can pull it. You can also show extra fields to partners (e.g., organizer contact) that the public can't see.

Use for: partner packages, invite-priority events, media previews.

Internal: Only your team sees it in the admin. It's hidden from all APIs/feeds and search.

Use for: drafts, embargoed events before a press release, quality assurance, testing.

items.question: What is API?
items.answer: An API is a way for two computer programs to talk to each other.

items.question: What is JSON?
items.answer: JSON is a structured text format that lets different programs share information.

items.question: What does the API provide?
items.answer:
(1) REST endpoints with filters (date, city, venue, tags), pagination, and sorting: simple web addresses to get event data back as tidy JSON, like: /api/events. You can also narrow results. Examples:

/api/events?date=2025-12-05 (events on a day)
/api/events?city=Koper&tags=family,free (family, free events in Koper)
/api/events?venue=taverna-koper (events at one venue)

(2) Webhooks for updates: you give us a URL, and we send you a message the moment an event is created, updated, or cancelled.

(3) Playground and code snippets: You can try the API in your browser without writing code. You pick filters (city, date range, tags) and see the JSON response plus stats (how many results, how long it took). It helps you learn the fields, spot mistakes, and share a working example with your team via a link.

items.question: Do you support agents?
items.answer: Yes. We support Model Context Protocol (MCP) so you can feed events into AI agents.

items.question: How stable is the API?
items.answer: We version the API and give clear timelines before changes.

items.question: What are SLAs?
items.answer: Service Level Agreements are the written promises we make to you about how reliable and responsive our solution will be. SLAs spell out targets (like uptime, speed, and support response times), how those are measured, and what you get if the targets aren't met (usually service credits).

items.question: Can partners get higher limits and SLAs?
items.answer: Yes. See the Partner plan for higher throughput, webhooks, and uptime SLAs.

items.question: Is there a free tier for builders?
items.answer: Yes we have a free tier with generous limits for developers and small projects.

items.question: Are there add-ons?
items.answer:
Optional add-ons include premium ingestion for venues without feeds*, advanced insights, white-label widgets, and a concierge handoff inbox**.

* Some venues don't provide an event feed (no ICS/CSV/API). Premium ingestion means we do the extra work to collect events directly from their website or sources and turn them into clean, structured entries that update automatically. Why it's "premium"? Every site is different, so we build and maintain a custom connector. If the venue changes its layout, we fix the connector. That ongoing work and monitoring is what you're paying for.

** A concierge handoff inbox is the place where conversations go when the chatbot can't (or shouldn't) handle them. The bot collects the user's details and question, then hands it to a human. Your team replies from that inbox.

items.question: Do you offer public-sector or multi-destination discounts?
items.answer: Yes. Contact us for details.

items.question: Can I cancel anytime?
items.answer: Yes. Cancel before the next billing cycle; export your data first if you like.

items.question: How do you handle privacy?
items.answer:
We follow GDPR principles. Newsletter sign-ups and handoffs are opt-in*. Personal data is minimized and encrypted in transit and at rest.

* We only contact people if they clearly ask us to. No automatic enrollments, no pre-ticked boxes, no sneaky fine print.

Newsletter sign-ups (opt-in): We offer the newsletter; the user chooses to subscribe. Every email includes an unsubscribe link. We don't add people who gave their email for other reasons (e.g., ticket help) unless they separately agree to marketing.

Concierge handoffs (opt-in): When the bot can't help, it asks permission to pass the question to a human. We collect the preferred contact (email/phone) and say we'll use it only for this request, unless they also opt in to marketing.

items.question: Will you ever hide features behind surprise paywalls?
items.answer: No. Limits and pricing are published; changes come with notice.

items.question: What about uptime and support?
items.answer: Email support for Pro and up; priority support and SLAs for Partner. Status and changelog are public.

items.question: How is OpenEvents related to Eventio Agent?
items.answer: OpenEvents is the open data layer. Eventio Agent is one business-focused application built on top. They're separate brands that can reference each other.

items.question: Can I try a demo?
items.answer: Yes. Use the playground with a free key or ask us for a guided demo.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.metaDescription: Privacy Policy for OpenEvents - Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when using our event data platform.
privacyPolicy.introduction: At OpenEvents, we are committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our platform.

sections.title: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: We collect information you provide directly to us, such as when you create an account, submit events, or contact us for support.
items: Account information (name, email address, password)
Event data you submit (event details, venues, organizers)
Usage information (how you interact with our platform)
Device and browser information
IP address and location data

sections.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
sections.content: We use the information we collect to:
items: Provide, maintain, and improve our services
Process and complete transactions
Send you technical notices and support messages
Respond to your comments and questions
Analyze usage patterns to improve user experience
Protect against fraud and unauthorized access

sections.title: 3. Information Sharing
sections.content: We do not sell your personal information. We may share your information in the following circumstances:
items: With your consent or at your direction
With service providers who assist in our operations
To comply with legal obligations
To protect our rights and prevent fraud
In connection with a business transfer or acquisition

sections.title: 4. Data Retention
sections.content: We retain your personal information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you services. You can request deletion of your data at any time by contacting us.

sections.title: 5. Your Rights (GDPR)
sections.content: If you are in the European Economic Area, you have certain rights regarding your personal data:
items: Right to access your personal data
Right to rectification of inaccurate data
Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
Right to restrict processing
Right to data portability
Right to object to processing
Right to withdraw consent

sections.title: 6. Cookies and Tracking
sections.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience, analyze usage, and assist in our marketing efforts. You can control cookie preferences through your browser settings.

sections.title: 7. Data Security
sections.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest.

sections.title: 8. Third-Party Services
sections.content: Our platform may contain links to third-party websites or integrate with third-party services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these third parties.

sections.title: 9. Children's Privacy
sections.content: Our services are not directed to children under 16. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 16.

sections.title: 10. Changes to This Policy
sections.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the 'Last updated' date.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at:

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.metaDescription: Terms of Service for OpenEvents - Read the terms and conditions for using our event data platform and API services.
termsOfService.introduction: Welcome to OpenEvents. By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. Please read them carefully.

sections.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
sections.content: By accessing or using OpenEvents, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and all applicable laws and regulations. If you do not agree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from using or accessing this platform.

sections.title: 2. Description of Service
sections.content: OpenEvents is a shared event data layer that allows users to:
items: Create, manage, and share event information
Access event data through our REST API
Integrate event data with third-party applications
Receive real-time updates via webhooks
Use AI-powered event data features via MCP

sections.title: 3. User Accounts
sections.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account.

sections.title: 4. Acceptable Use
sections.content: You agree not to:
items: Use the service for any unlawful purpose
Submit false, misleading, or fraudulent event information
Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
Interfere with or disrupt the service or servers
Scrape, crawl, or use automated means to access the service without permission
Violate any applicable laws or regulations

sections.title: 5. Content and Data
sections.content: You retain ownership of the event data you submit to OpenEvents. By submitting content, you grant us a license to use, display, and distribute that content as part of providing our services. You are responsible for ensuring you have the right to share any content you submit.

sections.title: 6. API Usage
sections.content: Use of our API is subject to rate limits and usage quotas based on your subscription plan. We reserve the right to modify or discontinue API access with reasonable notice. API keys must be kept confidential.

sections.title: 7. Subscription and Billing
sections.content: Paid features are billed according to your selected plan. You may cancel your subscription at any time before the next billing cycle. Refunds are handled on a case-by-case basis.

sections.title: 8. Intellectual Property
sections.content: The OpenEvents platform, including its design, features, and content (excluding user-submitted content), is protected by intellectual property laws. You may not copy, modify, or distribute our platform without permission.

sections.title: 9. Disclaimer of Warranties
sections.content: OpenEvents is provided 'as is' and 'as available' without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free.

sections.title: 10. Limitation of Liability
sections.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, OpenEvents and its affiliates shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the service.

sections.title: 11. Termination
sections.content: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your access to the service at any time for violation of these terms or for any other reason at our discretion.

sections.title: 12. Changes to Terms
sections.content: We may modify these Terms of Service at any time. We will notify users of significant changes via email or through the platform. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

sections.title: 13. Governing Law
sections.content: These Terms of Service shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Slovenia, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at:
